column4: I just installed Lucid on a Asus G72GX laptop and I want to use my speakers with it.  They work, however the internal speaker still is on.  How do I turn it off?
okie, I'll look for it now :)
you don't see the speaker in alsamixer?
I see master (which did what its supposed to do), headphone which don't effect either speakers, speaker which has no bar and stays at 00, PCM, Front, Surround all do nothing
that seems correct- have you tried looking at the sound preferences on the speaker icon in the panel?
yep, I don't see any way to change which speakers do what.
check the Output panel and verify that the Connector is what you want it to be
Says Internal Audio Analog Stereo.  Shouldn't it be something external?
probably- try some of the other ones and see if that fixes it
oh... well then. Sorry dont know the solution
one other thing to try is see if lsmod has pcspkr in it
Thanks for your efforts anyway :)  I'm going to keep at it
if it does- remove it and see if that addresses your problem
